meanings.definition: To cause to have a fever.
meanings.sent1: The hot weather enfevers the children during summer.
meanings.sent2: The flu enfevers many people in the winter months.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food enfevers my taste buds, but I can't resist it.
meanings.sent4: His passionate speech enfevers the crowd, stirring their emotions.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling movie enfevers the audience, keeping them on the edge of their seats.

meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun, he enfevers quickly.
meanings.sent2: When she catches a cold, she enfevers and feels weak.
meanings.sent3: The excitement of the game enfevers me, making me cheer loudly.
meanings.sent4: The intense competition enfevers the players, pushing them to do their best.
meanings.sent5: The suspenseful plot of the book enfevers the readers, making them eager to know what happens next.
